intro: Dinacrusa aegyptia, commonly known as the Egyptian cactus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in hot, dry environments through its succulent stems, which store water. It produces small, edible fruits that are sometimes used in local cuisines. Due to its resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-prone areas.
